content:
• Tuesday, March 6, 2012
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) +1.3% AH after Reuters reports Reed Hastings has "quietly met" with execs...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) +1.3% AH after Reuters reports Reed Hastings has "quietly met" with execs at top cable providers about making Netflix available as a subscription option. It's added "at least one cable operator could experiment with offering Netflix" by year's end. Hastings recently suggested Netflix will eventually be included in cable packages.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM | 10 Comments
  • UAN

    CVR Partners (NYSE:UAN) -2% AH after filing an S-1 regarding parent CVR Energy's (NYSE:CVI)...

    CVR Partners (NYSE:UAN) -2% AH after filing an S-1 regarding parent CVR Energy's (NYSE:CVI) plans to sell part of its stake in the company. CVR Energy, which has received a buyout offer from Carl Icahn, plans to use the proceeds from the sale to pay a special dividend to stockholders, and to strengthen its balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • WINT

    Discovery Labs (DSCO) resumes trading, with shares +26.7% AH following FDA approval of Surfaxin....

    Discovery Labs (DSCO) resumes trading, with shares +26.7% AH following FDA approval of Surfaxin. Shares spiked as high as $6.85 on resumption but have since pulled back to ~$3.75.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • MAKO

    MAKO Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q4 EPS of -$0.14 in-line. Revenue of $32.9M (+122.3% Y/Y) beats by...

    MAKO Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q4 EPS of -$0.14 in-line. Revenue of $32.9M (+122.3% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • P

    More on Pandora's (NYSE:P) FQ4: Listener hours totaled 2.7B, +29% Q/Q and +99% Y/Y. However, ad...

    More on Pandora's (NYSE:P) FQ4: Listener hours totaled 2.7B, +29% Q/Q and +99% Y/Y. However, ad revenue growth was slower (+9% Q/Q and +73% Y/Y), which suggests Pandora may be facing monetization challenges. Meanwhile, content acquisition costs (royalties) rose 101% Y/Y, and equaled 59% of revenue.Â  Pandora says it now has a 69.8% share among the top 20 U.S. Internet radio services, up 1150 bps Y/Y. P -13.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • YTEN

    Metabolix (MBLX): Q4 EPS of -$0.28 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $439K (+288% Y/Y) misses by $61K....

    Metabolix (MBLX): Q4 EPS of -$0.28 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $439K (+288% Y/Y) misses by $61K. Shares +4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • ALTH

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $15.4M (+44.4%...

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $15.4M (+44.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • P

    Pandora Media (NYSE:P): FQ4 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $81.4M (+71% Y/Y) misses...

    Pandora Media (NYSE:P): FQ4 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $81.4M (+71% Y/Y) misses by $1.8M. Company expects FQ1 revenue of $72M-$75M and EPS of -$0.18 to -$0.21, below consensus of $86.6M and -$0.02. Expects FY13 revenue of $410M-$420M and EPS of -$0.11 to -$0.16, largely below consensus of $418.3M and $0.01. Shares -12.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • SHPG

    Shares of ViroPharma (VPHM -6.3%) slump after the company releases results of its Phase 2 trial...

    Shares of ViroPharma (VPHM -6.3%) slump after the company releases results of its Phase 2 trial of its Cinryze treatment for angioedema in combination with Halozyme’s Enhaze drug delivery platform. Stifel Nicolaus says the data validates utilization, but warns logistical issues may pop up related to manufacturing capacity and cost before a twice-a-week dosing is a feasible option.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • GREK

    One country ETF green today? Greece (GREK +3%), courtesy of a big move higher in Athens as the...

    One country ETF green today? Greece (GREK +3%), courtesy of a big move higher in Athens as the rest of Europe dove. The ETF remains a stalwart for 2012, +20% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone Systems (PAY +7.7%) jumps after its FQ1 beat estimates across the board late yesterday....

    VeriFone Systems (PAY +7.7%) jumps after its FQ1 beat estimates across the board late yesterday. Net earnings swung to a loss howvever, as acquisition costs masked strong core profits on double digit organic growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • STRN

    Sutron (STRN +5.8%) gains after saying total bookings for 2012 January and February were...

    Sutron (STRN +5.8%) gains after saying total bookings for 2012 January and February were $5,135,057. Bookings for the month of February alone were $3,641,909, with strong sales in the U.S. public and private sectors.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • SLB

    Nymex crude oil futures drop 1.9% to end at $104.70/barrel, lowest since mid February, rattled...

    Nymex crude oil futures drop 1.9% to end at $104.70/barrel, lowest since mid February, rattled by concerns about the ripple effect of a potential disorderly default by Greece as well as China's lower growth outlook. Shares of the big oilfield services firms - SLB -3.1%, HAL -3.2%, BHI -2.4%, WFT -4.1%, NOV -3.5% - are pushed well below their target prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 3 Comments
  • MDSO

    Medidata Solutions (MDSO +14.9%) jumps after its Q4 results come in largely in line, but the...

    Medidata Solutions (MDSO +14.9%) jumps after its Q4 results come in largely in line, but the company projects Q1 and FY12 revenue to be above analysts expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko's (APC -2.3%) recent weakness may be a buying opportunity if you believe UBS. The firm...

    Anadarko's (APC -2.3%) recent weakness may be a buying opportunity if you believe UBS. The firm says the driller remains an attractive acquisition candidate and believes CEO Jim Hackett's planned retirement in 2013 is a deadline for a potential takeout. Shares are Buy rated with a $105 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • RL

    Despite the recent upswing in Ralph Lauren (RL -3.8%) shares, Goldman Sachs says the apparel...

    Despite the recent upswing in Ralph Lauren (RL -3.8%) shares, Goldman Sachs says the apparel company's brand "should deliver margin-accretive growth in the near and long term," reiterating its Conviction Buy rating and $200 price target. "While RL's valuation of 22x gives pause," current EPS estimates understate its potential, thus "the stock is more compelling than it seems."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • BVSN

    BroadVision (BVSN -15.1%) has another crazy day thanks to momentum traders. Shares jumped in...

    BroadVision (BVSN -15.1%) has another crazy day thanks to momentum traders. Shares jumped in early trading, and made a new 52-week high of $56.46 around 1PM ET. However, the stock has since cratered, and is now changing hands near $43. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • KIOR

    KiOR (KIOR +6.5%) pops after being upgraded earlier to Buy at ThinkEquity. The firm says it's...

    KiOR (KIOR +6.5%) pops after being upgraded earlier to Buy at ThinkEquity. The firm says it's approaching mechanical completion of its MS plant and will begin trial production shortly. ThinkEquity believes the facility will showcase its technology and be an inflection point for shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • CVGI

    Shares of Commercial Vehicle Group (CVGI -8.1%) trail off after paperwork filed with North...

    Shares of Commercial Vehicle Group (CVGI -8.1%) trail off after paperwork filed with North Carolina's Dept. of Commerce indicates that the company plans to lay off workers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • WINT

    Discovery Labs (DSCO +9.4%) shoots up on chatter that the firm may be in line to land FDA...

    Discovery Labs (DSCO +9.4%) shoots up on chatter that the firm may be in line to land FDA approval on Surfaxin for the treatment of respiratory illness in infants.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • CI

    Cowen's healthcare conference sparks renewed chatter that Cigna (CI -2.7%) could unload its...

    Cowen's healthcare conference sparks renewed chatter that Cigna (CI -2.7%) could unload its pharmacy benefit manager business, a move it considered in 2009. J.P. Morgan analysts say a sale would be the “best possible outcome” for CI's earnings; they also don’t rule out CI following Aetna in outsourcing its operations given CI believes the service is important.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • ALGT

    Allegiant Travel (ALGT +0.2%) says that for the month of February, its total system revenue...

    Allegiant Travel (ALGT +0.2%) says that for the month of February, its total system revenue passenger miles was up 20.7% over the same month last year. Available seat miles was also up 22.7%. Its load factor was 87.9%, down 1.5%, while departures were up 17.7% year-over-year. The company sees a 21% Y/Y increase in March departures and a 27% increase in available seat miles.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +6.7%) pops after saying the European Medicines Agency has granted its drug...

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +6.7%) pops after saying the European Medicines Agency has granted its drug CK-2017357, its fast skeletal muscle troponin activator, orphan medicinal product designation for the treatment of Lou Gehrig's Disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • NVS

    Novartis (NVS -2%) trades down after JP Morgan cut the shares to Neutral, saying a company...

    Novartis (NVS -2%) trades down after JP Morgan cut the shares to Neutral, saying a company break-up, while unlikely, may be the only way to create shareholder value.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (GDOT -6%) sells off after it's learned American Express (NYSE:AXP) is trialing the...

    Green Dot (GDOT -6%) sells off after it's learned American Express (NYSE:AXP) is trialing the sale of its Bluebird prepaid cards at Wal-Mart. AmEx's card could represent competition for Wal-Mart's MoneyCard, which is managed by Green Dot courtesy of a contract that runs through May 2015. Jefferies is defending Green Dot, stating it believes Bluebird features a variety of fees.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • CRZO

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (CRZO -2.9%) slips after Imperial Capital cut the shares to In-Line and...

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (CRZO -2.9%) slips after Imperial Capital cut the shares to In-Line and lowered its price target to $30 from $35.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • KCP

    Shares of Kenneth Cole Productions (KCP +0.1%) move higher off of a report that the company has...

    Shares of Kenneth Cole Productions (KCP +0.1%) move higher off of a report that the company has hired Merrill Lynch as an adviser in the midst of ongoing M&A speculation.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • EPAY

    Bottomline Technologies (EPAY -5%) takes a hit after Craig-Hallum downgraded the stock to Hold...

    Bottomline Technologies (EPAY -5%) takes a hit after Craig-Hallum downgraded the stock to Hold earlier today on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • LFC

    China Life Insurance (LFC -8.3%) tumbles after it says 2011 net income may have shrank 40-50%...

    China Life Insurance (LFC -8.3%) tumbles after it says 2011 net income may have shrank 40-50% from a year earlier due to declines in investment yields and increases in investment impairment losses from gyrating capital markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -3.2%) reports a $56M charge for losses in Greece when it failed to...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -3.2%) reports a $56M charge for losses in Greece when it failed to receive payments from a distributor. While STJ says revenue from Greece does not impact its 2012 guidance, Citigroup's Matthew Dodds says the "exceedingly large" size of the write-off "makes it pretty clear this was their primary channel" in the country. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • PDCE

    PDC Energy (PETD -5%) takes a hit despite being upgraded to Buy at Brean Murray earlier today....

    PDC Energy (PETD -5%) takes a hit despite being upgraded to Buy at Brean Murray earlier today. The firm believes PDC's 2012 activity in the Wattenberg Field and Utica Shale will drive additional value and improve margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -7.5%) shares plummet as William Blair says it heard of at least two high-level...

    Polycom (PLCM -7.5%) shares plummet as William Blair says it heard of at least two high-level departures in PLCM's U.S. sales organization, including George Lillig, vice president of its U.S. government, education and medical unit. The firm believes the timing of the departures is a negative indicator for PLCM’s Q1 U.S. sales performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • FSLR

    Though outperforming its solar peers (TAN -4.5%), First Solar (FSLR -1.4%) has sold off to a...

    Though outperforming its solar peers (TAN -4.5%), First Solar (FSLR -1.4%) has sold off to a level last seen in January 2007; shares are now down 24% since the company posted a dismal Q4 report. A note from Canaccord goes over some of the challenges facing the company: falling margins, industry oversupply, China's growth slowdown, an an eroding cost advantage for First Solar's thin-film technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +2.2%) says it has secured three production contracts for lithium ion engine...

    A123 Systems (AONE +2.2%) says it has secured three production contracts for lithium ion engine start batteries. The pacts with "three leading European automakers" are production contracts for the company’s 12V Engine Start Battery. AONE shares have been sliding since the company issued a Q4 warning and delayed its 10-K filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • SMP

    Standard Motor Products (SMP -16.7%) drops after its Q4 revenue fell short of Street...

    Standard Motor Products (SMP -16.7%) drops after its Q4 revenue fell short of Street projections. The company also guided to Q1 sales flat to slightly below its 2011 Q1 numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • ZLTQ

    Shares of Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ -26.3%) crater after the firm misses the estimates of analysts...

    Shares of Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ -26.3%) crater after the firm misses the estimates of analysts with its Q4 report and comes in with weak guidance for FY12.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +3.5%) moves up after ThinkEquity raised it to Hold from Sell on...

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +3.5%) moves up after ThinkEquity raised it to Hold from Sell on valuation earlier today, saying it sees little downside to current levels and it believes increasing industry sapphire prices will boost the stock over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • YELP

    After soaring on its first day of trading, Yelp (YELP -3.4%) has fallen sharply this week....

    After soaring on its first day of trading, Yelp (YELP -3.4%) has fallen sharply this week. Shares are now down 23% from their post-IPO peak, making Henry Blodget's bearish call look smart for the time being.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • RIGL

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL -9.5%) drops after a hard miss on its Q4 EPS. Operating expenses...

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL -9.5%) drops after a hard miss on its Q4 EPS. Operating expenses soared 25% Y/Y, primarily due to the increase in R&D expenses related to R343, its inhaled inhibitor program for asthma, and R333, its topical inhibitor program for lupus.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • VRML

    Vermillion (VRML +54.1%) shares soar after the molecular diagnostics company says it received...

    Vermillion (VRML +54.1%) shares soar after the molecular diagnostics company says it received Category 1 CPT Code approval for OVA1 test designed to help differentiate benign vs. malignant ovarian masses. VRML also says it received a notice of allowance from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for a patent for "platelet biomarkers for cancer."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (SDRL -4.5%) trades lower after being initiated with an Underperform at Bernstein,...

    Seadrill (SDRL -4.5%) trades lower after being initiated with an Underperform at Bernstein, saying its valuation reflects unrealistic time expectations for the upcycle's duration.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • MS

    Bank bonds are crushed in early trading, as the risk premium on intermediate term notes from...

    Bank bonds are crushed in early trading, as the risk premium on intermediate term notes from Morgan Stanley, UBS and Goldman widen 0.14, 0.22, and 0.35 percentage points, respectively, and short-term paper from BofA and US Bancorp weaken 0.16 and 0.24 points. Their stocks are sinking too: MS -4.8%, UBS -3.9%, GS -3.8%, BAC -3%, USB -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • CAKE

    Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -1.1%) expresses at the Raymond James Institutional Investors...

    Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -1.1%) expresses at the Raymond James Institutional Investors Conference that it sees FY12 EPS moving up 10% to 16%, as significant opportunities in global markets start to contribute.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI +2.8%) shares rally following a WSJ article discussing a potential recovery, as the...

    THQ (THQI +2.8%) shares rally following a WSJ article discussing a potential recovery, as the maker of video games and accessories pins its hopes on a turnaround plan after its unsuccessful uDraw tablet and other strategic missteps. "They can't make another mistake," a Wedbush analyst says. "If they turn left instead of right, they'll run out of cash."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • OVTI

    Baird tips off that the latest iPad tablet will use camera sensors from OmniVision (OVTI +5.6%),...

    Baird tips off that the latest iPad tablet will use camera sensors from OmniVision (OVTI +5.6%), with a 5 megapixel sensor in the rear camera and a 1 megapixel sensor in the front camera.  Analysts raise OVTI to Outperform on the potential for outfitting the iPad HD , as well as the upcoming iPad Mini.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX -4.7%) sells off after the USPTO declares a "patent interference"...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX -4.7%) sells off after the USPTO declares a "patent interference" between a patent held by Idenix, and one held by Gilead Sciences' (NASDAQ:GILD) recently-acquired Pharmasset division. Both patents relate to compounds that can be used to help treat hepatitis C infections. Idenix says the claimed interference isn't relevant to its IDX184 drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley (VRA -2.2%) gets clipped by analysts at Keybanc with a downgrade to Hold from Buy...

    Vera Bradley (VRA -2.2%) gets clipped by analysts at Keybanc with a downgrade to Hold from Buy and a removal of a price target of $44. The firm says that it's staying on the sidelines due to concerns on Vera Bradley's near-term margins and the ongoing underperformance of shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • SSI

    Shares of Stage Stores (SSI -4.8%) after the company misses earnings estimate with its Q4...

    Shares of Stage Stores (SSI -4.8%) after the company misses earnings estimate with its Q4 report. The company says that its increased promotional activities and inability to pass off cost increases negatively impacted margins. For FY12, the retailer sees sales of $1.584B-$1.1613B and EPS falling between $1.02 and $1.14.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • NX

    Quanex Building Products (NX -9.6%) shares slide after reporting a wider-than-expected FQ1 loss,...

    Quanex Building Products (NX -9.6%) shares slide after reporting a wider-than-expected FQ1 loss, as consolidation costs and continued weak demand from the housing market weighed on the bottom line. Increasing residential foreclosures and stringent credit conditions will make this a difficult year for the housing industry, the company says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +13.7%) soars after providing an operational update. The company...

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +13.7%) soars after providing an operational update. The company says its Venezuelan operations produced an average of 31,205 barrels/day last year, up 33% Y/Y, and that oil was discovered at an exploration well in Gabon.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • VVUS

    Jefferies says an editorial published in the cardiology journal Circulation, which advocates the...

    Jefferies says an editorial published in the cardiology journal Circulation, which advocates the idea of pre-approval CV safety testing for obesity drugs such as Vivus' (VVUS -6.9%) Qnexa, is "incrementally negative" for VVUS. The extra layer of testing would be a setback for VVUS, whose shares have doubled since an FDA panel backed Qnexa for obesity on Feb. 22 by a 20-2 vote.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM

  • Market preview: It's a sea of red for Super Tuesday as Greece edges towards default and on...

    Market preview: It's a sea of red for Super Tuesday as Greece edges towards default and on worries over global growth, with S&P Benchmark futures -0.9%. Oil is -1%, following the equities trend and also possibly because of renewed optimism on Iran. Monster Worldwide (+6.9%) is set for a monster day after it says it's considering its strategic options.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 3 Comments
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) and AEterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) move lower in...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) and AEterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) move lower in premarket trading after the credibility of Jeremy Richards is openly questioned by Adam Feuerstein. Richards claimed that FDA approval on colon cancer drug perifosine was "practically a done deal" in a SA piece. KERX -7.7%, AEZS -12.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • VRML

    Premarket gainers: VRML +14%. HNR +12%. CYTK +10%. NBG +8%. MWW +7%.Losers: ONTY -40%. ZLTQ...

    Premarket gainers: VRML +14%. HNR +12%. CYTK +10%. NBG +8%. MWW +7%.
    Losers: ONTY -40%. ZLTQ -14%. AEZS -12%. NTRI -11%. KERX -8%. RAS -6%. VVUS -6%. CNX -5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) -1.6% premarket on news the investment firm suffered a $103M net loss in...

    Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) -1.6% premarket on news the investment firm suffered a $103M net loss in Asia for 2011, its first loss in Asia since 2008. GS cited weak markets that took a toll on lending and investing, as well as a mark-to-market loss in its holdings of shares in Industrial & Commercial Bank of China. In 2010, Goldman earned $2.1B in Asia.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • GA

    Giant Interactive (NYSE:GA) +2.6% premarket after reporting strong jumps in Q4 earnings and...

    Giant Interactive (NYSE:GA) +2.6% premarket after reporting strong jumps in Q4 earnings and revenues and raising its annual dividend. The Chinese online game company saw its online user base and average revenue per user rise amid continued strength from its ZT Online game.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • DRWI

    Shares of DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) come off of a trading halt down 12.9% premarket after the...

    Shares of DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) come off of a trading halt down 12.9% premarket after the company issues a stark outlook for Q4 sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) +13.1% premarket after reporting 2011 Venezuela production...

    Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) +13.1% premarket after reporting 2011 Venezuela production was ~11.39M barrels of oil for a daily average of 31,205 bpd, up 33% Y/Y. Total proved plus probable reserves on Dec. 31 were 103.7 MMBOE, down 13% Y/Y, reflecting a sale of Utah assets which included 15.3 MMBOE.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • DATE

    Chinese internet dating site Jiayuan.com (NASDAQ:DATE) -3% premarket after reporting Q4 EPS and...

    Chinese internet dating site Jiayuan.com (NASDAQ:DATE) -3% premarket after reporting Q4 EPS and revenues below consensus and issuing downward revenue guidance. Stifel Nicolaus lowers shares to Hold from Buy on higher expenses, margin compression and increased competition. BofA cuts its rating to Underperform and its price target to $6.60 from $13.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • MTN

    The lowest snowfall in 30 years in Colorado contributes to a FQ2 earnings miss by Vail Resorts...

    The lowest snowfall in 30 years in Colorado contributes to a FQ2 earnings miss by Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN). The company says visits to its Colorado resorts declined 8.8% Y/Y during the quarter, while Tahoe saw a 32.6% falloff. As a result, revised guidance from Vail calls for resort reported FY12 EBITDA to fall in a range of $205M-$215M. Shares -4.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) slashes its outlook for Q4 sales due to delays to customers in North...

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) slashes its outlook for Q4 sales due to delays to customers in North America. The company now sees sales of only $9.4M, down from prior guidance of $12M-$15M and well-below the Street's mark of $13.87M. Shares -3.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • BLT

    Blount International (NYSE:BLT): Q4 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $236.5M (+38.3%...

    Blount International (NYSE:BLT): Q4 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $236.5M (+38.3% Y/Y) in-line. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • MTN

    Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN): FQ2 EPS of $1.27 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $373.3M (-5.5% Y/Y) misses...

    Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN): FQ2 EPS of $1.27 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $373.3M (-5.5% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares -3.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
